Articles.Content:
On the issue of TAC vs ECLSS support (both of which are fine mods in their own rights), is there a TAC converted version of the soviet parts pack for people wishing to use TAC life support? mostly one that doesnt interfere with TAC's oxygen levels and has the scrubbers setup for TAC instead of the ECLSS ones? having issues with ECLSS after the 0.23.5 update, and TAC has a slightly more active update schedule (also i have heard ECLSS has a small issue of lagging lower end systems, i have not seen this myself, but i am putting a package together for a few people and soviet parts are a must for afew of them, but so is TAC...)

Edited April 8, 2014 by Guest
Is there any way I can get just the Soyuz craft and the Soyuz rocket. Will deleting the buran shuttle corrupt anything.
Nope, in fact, you can download the latest Soyuz update and remove the old Soviet Pack.

Nope, in fact, you can download the latest Soyuz update and remove the old Soviet Pack.

Thanks. I just need an efficient way to transfers crew and I already have KSO.

Know what. I think some probes should be made. I want the Mars 98, Fobos-Grunt, GLONASS, and a Revised Proton-M. That's good. Oh, and a retextured old Soyuz (like thees:) with an APAS-75 like in the Apollo-Soyuz missions, and a Salyut 6. This being AFTER you get some free time. I don't like to feel greedy. Still, that old Soyuz is due for some updates, and we need a Salyut. Ooh, and the probes. Oh I forgot! Venrera and Vega too! Plz?

Edited April 9, 2014 by Pockrtplanesairways
Oh my. Here comes an angry response.

Old Soyuz would be hard to make, you'd need a completely new ship. It's simply too different. Different RCS, different panels... I'd say, a revised Proton and MIR would be enough for now. Leave probes to MrTheBull.

Oh my. Here comes an angry response.

I said for him to do this when he has free time.

I said for him to do this when he has free time.

Yes, but it still looks VERY greedy when you post a wishlist that large at a modders thread, even if you don't mean it. And just so you know it, Bobcat has already stated that he will only be maintaining one soyuz, the Soyuz-TMA.

EDIT: You posted eight requests - that's a LOT of parts - and started it all with "I want". You simply do not say "I want". Use something like "It'd be awesome to see a..." or even better, you could throw your requests out with something like this: "For inspiration, if you ever run out of things to do, you could do something like the Venera probes or a Salyut station, or maybe one of the really old soyuz's?"

Edited April 9, 2014 by wasmic

Yes, but it still looks VERY greedy when you post a wishlist that large at a modders thread, even if you don't mean it. And just so you know it, Bobcat has already stated that he will only be maintaining one soyuz, the Soyuz-TMA.

EDIT: You posted eight requests - that's a LOT of parts - and started it all with "I want". You simply do not say "I want". Use something like "It'd be awesome to see a..." or even better, you could throw your requests out with something like this: "For inspiration, if you ever run out of things to do, you could do something like the Venera probes or a Salyut station, or maybe one of the really old soyuz's?"

Well I'd like at the least, just one update to the old soyuz to make it look like this: Minus the weird windows where the parachutes should be and a landing engine on this too. And a mate docking node.(The soyuz has to have a mate docking node.)

EDIT: I have installed ECLSS but the screens still aren't working in the Soyuz-TMA 2.0. IDK

Edited April 10, 2014 by Pockrtplanesairways

You don't get it do you? BobCat said nothing new. That means nothing new. Not "I would like at the very least the old Soyuz to be changed to look like this..." When you say 'at the very least', it sounds as if you ordered something from him and he failed to deliver, so you are asking for compensation. That is not the case. BobCat spends his free time making these (absolutely stunning quality) models. He distributes them free of charge so we can use them. You are not paying him, so you have no right to demand anything.

By the way you write, it seems to me that you consider yourself somehow higher than others. If I had made the mistake of posting such a large request list when BobCat said that he will not be making anything new in the near future, as well as starting the list with "I want", I would definately not do what you did and use the phrase "At the very least" in your reply to someone who tells you that what you did is considered rude.

And another thing: that Soyuz that you so insist on getting is not the same version of the Soyuz that BobCat has made. He made the original Soyuz and the -TMA. What you want is something I between the two (I'm not sure which one, but I think it is the ASTP Soyuz. Someone corrected me if it is something different), so re texturing Soyuz to look like it would not make sense.

Now, I've got a great idea! How about you stop pestering BobCat and go learn to use Blender or Sketchup. Then you can make yourself a blue Soyuz, and everyone will be happy! Yay!!!

I took some screen shots of the new Soyuz on a mission to my Mir clone.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Thanks Bobcat the new Soyuz is beautiful!!!

Also I think the craft Pockrtplanesairways is going on about is the Soyuz 7K-OK.

Edited April 10, 2014 by roscosmos

Well I'd like at the least, just one update to the old soyuz to make it look like this: http://www.aircraftresourcecenter.com/Gal8/7901-8000/gal7935-Soyuz-Kus/03.jpg Minus the weird windows where the parachutes should be and a landing engine on this too. And a mate docking node.(The soyuz has to have a mate docking node.)

Soyuz never flew in white, or green, or purple.

You only see these "naked" models in mockups or museum pieces. Soyuz has always been covered with thermal blankets in flight.

Actually, it did fly in green: http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e7/Soyuz-19_Docking_End.jpg

At least on ASTP, it's blankets were colored green. There's evidence that suggests that before the post-ASTP Soyuz, green was the standard color.

Still, a reskin won't do. The Soyuz 7K is a completely different ship thank Soyuz TMA.
Gee thanks Ros now I HAVE to download this Awesome station.

You don't get it do you? BobCat said nothing new. That means nothing new. Not "I would like at the very least the old Soyuz to be changed to look like this..." When you say 'at the very least', it sounds as if you ordered something from him and he failed to deliver, so you are asking for compensation. That is not the case. BobCat spends his free time making these (absolutely stunning quality) models. He distributes them free of charge so we can use them. You are not paying him, so you have no right to demand anything.

By the way you write, it seems to me that you consider yourself somehow higher than others. If I had made the mistake of posting such a large request list when BobCat said that he will not be making anything new in the near future, as well as starting the list with "I want", I would definately not do what you did and use the phrase "At the very least" in your reply to someone who tells you that what you did is considered rude.

And another thing: that Soyuz that you so insist on getting is not the same version of the Soyuz that BobCat has made. He made the original Soyuz and the -TMA. What you want is something I between the two (I'm not sure which one, but I think it is the ASTP Soyuz. Someone corrected me if it is something different), so re texturing Soyuz to look like it would not make sense.

Now, I've got a great idea! How about you stop pestering BobCat and go learn to use Blender or Sketchup. Then you can make yourself a blue Soyuz, and everyone will be happy! Yay!!!

I'm not demanding, smart@$$. I'm politely asking him. But I still would please like to see ONE more update for the old soyuz. I would like a bare one. Since, you know, KSP doesn't have thermal effects YET.
KSP does have thermal effects, and BobCat has made a custom thing where burn marks appear on the Soyuz after reentry.
Please keep things friendly in here and don't lower yourself to name-calling

First off, let me express my gratitude for creating such a great mod. I thoroughly enjoy the Soviet pack; it really makes station-building feel more realistic. The Buran continues to be the best shuttle I've flown.

Now, a quick question (this may have been answered earlier in the thread, but the searches I ran came up empty):

I've got a Progress module docked to my MIR with some KAS-attachable parts inside. While on EVA, I'm unable to "open the container" and retrieve these parts. How am I to go about doing that?

Im a big fan of BobCat, so first off THANK YOU BobCat for a wonderfull addition to KSP

Now.. ive been away for a bit and came back to have a go at KSP, so its now .23 and various mods dont work (as expected).

But the problem now is, what the duce do i need to get going again?

Ive tryed putting in the soviet pack and it worked out fine, but after adding in the new Soyuz pack the game got messed up, all kerbals (lower right) were missing and the Stages (on the left) allso disappered, and i had no option to start or operate my engiens :S

My question is what do i need and how. I hope you guys can help me and im very sorry for sounding like a noob :S

I Present to you: the Kerpollo-Soyuz Test Project! (KSTP)

(just something I did while I was bored)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Im a big fan of BobCat, so first off THANK YOU BobCat for a wonderfull addition to KSP

Now.. ive been away for a bit and came back to have a go at KSP, so its now .23 and various mods dont work (as expected).

But the problem now is, what the duce do i need to get going again?

Ive tryed putting in the soviet pack and it worked out fine, but after adding in the new Soyuz pack the game got messed up, all kerbals (lower right) were missing and the Stages (on the left) allso disappered, and i had no option to start or operate my engiens :S

My question is what do i need and how. I hope you guys can help me and im very sorry for sounding like a noob :S

Its probably the ECLSS life support mod try removing the life support plugin and folder and see if that helps

KSP does have thermal effects, and BobCat has made a custom thing where burn marks appear on the Soyuz after reentry.

I know about DRE. I'm not stupid. I mean stock.
Love the new Soyuz! I hope this means you are gonna be updating the rest of the soviet pack soon? As always keep up the amazing work!

I know about DRE. I'm not stupid. I mean stock.

Vanilla KSP has 'thermal effects', even without DRE. BobCat's burn mark effects need DRE to work, however.
